data.text: of a color similar to that of vanilla ice cream
a sweet flavored frozen food containing cream or butterfat and usually eggs
a brick of from two to four layers of ice cream of different flavors
a small armless chair with a circular seat for use at a table (as at a café)
a thin crisp edible cone for holding ice cream; also: one filled with ice cream
a dish consisting of ice cream served with toppings (such as crushed fruit, syrup, nuts, or whipped cream)
examples: … at about 700 locations, the company is testing “dessert stations” behind the counter where employees can make sundaes topped with cake or brownie chunks.

According to the legend, the ice-cream sundae was first concocted in 1881 at a soda fountain at 1404 15th Street, Two Rivers. The addition of chocolate increased its cost, and to limit the demand, it was sold on Sunday only.

On the sweet side, area eateries have plenty of tempting treats to help you keep your cool—like the "Unicorn Junior," a tasty, quirky take on the traditional ice cream sundae made with cotton candy ice cream, marshmallow sauce and a magical scoop of Lucky Charms.
